import { Story, Preview, Meta } from '@storybook/addon-docs/blocks';

<Meta title="Third-Party/Gutenberg" />

# WordPress Gutenberg Blocks

Gutenberg blocks that can be themed by default without using element selectors
have generated class names starting with `wp-block-`. This class may be added
to the block element itself or a wrapper.

## Quote

The quote has a control to add an optional `is-style-large` class.

<Preview>
  <Story name="core/quote" height="100px">
    {`<blockquote class="wp-block-quote is-style-large">
      <p>In quoting others, we cite ourselves.</p><cite>Julio Cortázar</cite>
    </blockquote>`}
  </Story>
</Preview>

## Image

The image is wrapped in a `figure` element with the `wp-block-image` class.

Inputs are available for `alt` text, `width`, and `height`.

Controls set either the `is-style-default` (no masking) or `is-style-circle-mask`
class on the wrapper element.

Additional controls can add wrapper classes based on generated `srcset` options:
`size-full`, `size-large`, `size-medium`, or `size-thumbnail`. Further resizing
adds the `is-resized` class to the wrapper.

Adding caption text to the image generates a `figcaption` element.

<Preview>
  <Story name="core/image" height="500px">
    {`<figure class="wp-block-image size-large is-style-default">
        <img
          src="https://s.w.org/images/core/5.3/MtBlanc1.jpg"
          alt="Mont Blanc"
          class="wp-image-130"
          srcset="
            https://s.w.org/images/core/5.3/MtBlanc1.jpg         500w,
            https://s.w.org/images/core/5.3/MtBlanc1-300x225.jpg 300w
          "
          sizes="(max-width: 500px) 100vw, 500px"
        />
        <figcaption>Mont Blanc appears—still, snowy, and serene.</figcaption>
      </figure>`}
  </Story>
</Preview>

## Gallery

The gallery block is wrapped in a `figure` element with the `wp-block-gallery` class.

In the block's settings, the user can choose a number of columns, which adds a `columns-x` class.

The gallery itself is a `ul` element with the class `blocks-gallery-grid` and each
item has a class of `blocks-gallery-item`

<Preview>
  <Story name="core/gallery" height="500px">
    {`<figure class="wp-block-gallery columns-2 is-cropped">
      <ul class="blocks-gallery-grid">
        <li class="blocks-gallery-item">
          <figure><img src="https://s.w.org/images/core/5.3/Glacial_lakes%2C_Bhutan.jpg" /></figure>
        </li>
        <li class="blocks-gallery-item">
          <figure><img src="https://s.w.org/images/core/5.3/Sediment_off_the_Yucatan_Peninsula.jpg" /></figure>
        </li>
        <li class="blocks-gallery-item">
          <figure><img src="https://s.w.org/images/core/5.3/Biologia_Centrali-Americana_-_Cantorchilus_semibadius_1902.jpg" /></figure>
        </li>
        <li class="blocks-gallery-item">
          <figure><img src="https://s.w.org/images/core/5.3/Windbuchencom.jpg" /></figure>
        </li>
      </ul>
    </figure>`}
  </Story>
</Preview>
